meanings.definition: Not fond of reading or studying books.
meanings.sent1: She was so unbookish that she preferred playing outside to reading.
meanings.sent2: His unbookish behavior was evident when he avoided the library at all costs.
meanings.sent3: The unbookish cat knocked over the bookshelf in protest of literature.
meanings.sent4: Her unbookish nature was like a bright light in a room full of bookworms.
meanings.sent5: The unbookish student's desk was always empty, devoid of any textbooks.

meanings.definition: Lacking in scholarly or intellectual interests.
meanings.sent1: His unbookish attitude towards academics worried his teachers.
meanings.sent2: The unbookish professor showed little interest in discussing literature.
meanings.sent3: The unbookish scientist preferred hands-on experiments over theoretical studies.
meanings.sent4: Her unbookish mind was like a blank canvas waiting to be filled with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The unbookish scholar's office was filled with sports memorabilia instead of books.
